title: Tunable Efficient Unitary Neural Networks (EUNN) and their application to RNNs
abstract: We present a method for implementing an Efficient Unitary Neural Network (EUNN) whose computational complexity is merely $\mathcal{O}(1)$ per parameter and has full tunability, from spanning part of unitary space to all of it. We apply the EUNN in Recurrent Neural Networks, and test its performance on the standard copying task and the MNIST digit recognition benchmark, finding that it significantly outperforms a non-unitary RNN, an LSTM network, an exclusively partial space URNN and a projective URNN with comparable parameter numbers.
